items.title: A Pier Deal Is Full of Developer Perks, but Is It Good for the City?
items.abstract: Generous incentives will secure a project that keeps New York’s motion picture industry competitive, officials say. Critics call the price too steep.

items.title: Why China Doesn’t Have a Property Tax
items.abstract: Local governments are sinking further into debt, but after years of talk, officials have yet to introduce a real estate tax.

items.title: Adams Orders New Round of Budget Cuts That Could Erode City Services
items.abstract: The Police Department, schools and CUNY won’t be spared in latest round of New York City budget reductions.

items.title: The 15-Minute City: Where Urban Planning Meets Conspiracy Theories
items.abstract: Is having all of life’s amenities within a 15-minute walk convenient? Or is it a government leash? We explain.

items.title: China’s Cities Are Cutting Health Insurance, and People Are Angry
items.abstract: Local governments, short on money after three years of “zero Covid” and faced with many more retirees, are raising costs and overhauling benefits.
